mapper.update: UPDATE tb_goods SET deleteStatus ='Y' ,categoryCode = 0 WHERE barcode = #{barcode}
mapper.select: SELECT COUNT(1) FROM tb_goods WHERE barcode = #{barcode};

SELECT g.barcode, g.businessCode, g.categoryCode, g.goodsName, g.weight, g.unit , g.maker,g.taxType, g.purchasePrice, g.salesPrice, g.margin, g.uncheckedQTY , g.warehouseStock, g.showcaseStock, g.goodsTotalStock, g.martCode, g.ID, g.regDate , c.categoryName, b.businessName ,u.name FROM tb_category AS c INNER JOIN tb_goods AS g on c.categoryCode = g.categoryCode INNER join tb_business AS b on g.businessCode = b.businessCode INNER join tb_user AS u ON g.ID = u.ID WHERE g.barcode = #{barcode}

SELECT g.barcode, g.businessCode, g.categoryCode, g.goodsName, g.weight, g.unit, g.maker , g.taxType, g.purchasePrice, g.salesPrice, g.margin, g.uncheckedQTY, g.warehouseStock , g.showcaseStock, g.goodsTotalStock, g.martCode, g.ID, g.regDate, g.deleteStatus , u.name, c.categoryName, b.businessName FROM tb_category AS c INNER JOIN tb_goods AS g on c.categoryCode = g.categoryCode INNER join tb_business AS b on g.businessCode = b.businessCode INNER join tb_user AS u ON g.ID = u.ID WHERE g.martCode = #{martCode} AND g.deleteStatus = 'N' ORDER BY g.regDate ASC
SELECT p.IDX, p.purchasePrice, p.regDate, u.name FROM tb_purchasePrice AS p INNER join tb_user AS u ON p.ID = u.ID WHERE p.barcode = #{barcode} ORDER BY p.regDate DESC
SELECT s.IDX, s.salesPrice, s.regDate, u.name FROM tb_salesPrice AS s INNER join tb_user AS u ON s.ID = u.ID WHERE s.barcode = #{barcode} ORDER BY s.regDate DESC
